result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Martinez not in court. 
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11-16-2022.
Return on warrant scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Juan Martinez not in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Juan Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case calendared for a calendar call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance. 
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner, and forfeiture of bond.

Defendant Juan Martinez not in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Juan Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no Court Reporter availability. Case scheduled for status conference. Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed. 
Attorney John Krejci

Defendant Juan Martinez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney John Krejci to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant to repay the County at a rate of $ 50.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 5/01/2023.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.

Defendant Juan Martinez in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Defendant advises Court he is retaining attorney Andrew Golden.  Court will adjourn case for status conference.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Martinez in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense does not have counsel. Court discussed with defendant eligibility for court appointed attorney. Defendant does not qualify. 
Defense requests additional time to retain private counsel. Granted by the court.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Martinez in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant does not qualify for a state public defender.  Defendant request time to hire private counsel. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 for a status of counsel. 
This hearing will be held  In person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan Martinez in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Juan Martinez
Current: 3775 S 27th Street #215, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: 920 West Walker Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/03/2022@01:00pm
